docblock.description: Cache Provider based on Memcached. It provides a relatively fast memory caching (slower than APC, though), but normally allows huge amounts of objects and big objects to be stored. Memcached daemon can also be setup to run in a server cluster.

* isPersistentConnection: Whether to use a persistent connection to Memcached servers or not. This is actually only taken into account on the Disconnect method due to the way Memcached works. * isCompression: Whether to compress cache or not. Defaulted to false. When isCompression is set to false, the method append is much faster.

var.description: $config Holds the configuration of the cache provider when needed; things like host, port and password. This is set by the Cache object from the Cherrycake configuration files when this cache provider is setup.

docblock.description: Connects to the cache provider if needed. Intended to be overloaded by a higher level cache system implementation class.
Disconnects from the cache provider if needed.

return.description: True if the disconnection has been done, false otherwise

docblock.description: Stores a value in the Memcached cache.

param.description: The identifier key
The value
The TTL (Time To Live) of the stored value in seconds since now

return.description: Wether the value has been correctly stored. False otherwise

docblock.description: Gets a value from the Memcached cache.

param.description: The identifier key

return.description: The stored value or false if it doesn't exists.

docblock.description: Deletes a value from the Memcached cache.

param.description: The identifier key for the object to be deleted

return.description: True if the object could be deleted. False otherwise

docblock.description: Increments a number stored in the cache by the given step

param.description: The identified key for the object to be incremented
The amount to increment the value, defaults to 1

return.description: The current value stored in the cache key, or false if error

docblock.description:
Appends the given value to the existent value in the cache. The key must already exists, or error will be returned.
The $ttl parameter is ignored for Memcached since memcached does not provides a way of changing the TTL when appending contents to an existent cache item.
When the config key "isCompression" is set to false, this method is much faster because it can use Memcached's own "append" mechanism.

param.description: The item key to append the given value to
The string to append
The TTL (Time To Live) of the stored value in seconds since now

return.description: Wether the value has been correctly stored. False otherwise

docblock.description: Checks whether a value is stored or not in the Memcached cache. Since Memcached hasn't an specific method to check for the existence of an object, a workaround is done here (probably slow)

param.description: identifier key

return.description: True if the value exists in the cache, false otherwise

docblock.description: Stablishes a new expiration TTL for an element in the Memcached cache.

param.description: The identifier key for the object to be touched
The new TTL (Time To Live) for the stored value in seconds

var.description: $isConnected Whether this cache is connected to the provider, when needed

docblock.description: Sets the configuration of the cache provider.

param.description: The cache provider parameters
The configuration key

docblock.description: Connects to the cache provider. Intended to be overloaded by a higher level cache system implementation class.
Disconnects from the cache provider if needed.

return.description: True if the disconnection has been done, false otherwise

docblock.description: Calls the connect method in case this provider is not yet connected

description.compact: Returns a string representation of the value passed to be stored on the cache

param.description: The value to serialize
The value to unserialize
The identifier key
The value
The TTL (Time To Live) of the stored value in seconds since now

return.description: Whether the value has been correctly stored. False otherwise

description.compact: Gets a value from the cache.

param.description: The identifier key

return.description: The stored value or false if it doesn't exists.

description.compact: Deletes a value from the cache.

param.description: The identifier key for the object to be deleted

return.description: True if the object could be deleted. False otherwise

description.compact: Increments a number stored in the cache by the given step

param.description: The identified key for the object to be incremented
The amount to increment the value, defaults to 1

return.description: The current value stored in the cache key, or false if error

description.compact: Appends the given value to the existent value in the cache. The key must already exists, or error will be returned.

param.description: The item key to append the given value to
The string to append
The TTL (Time To Live) of the stored value in seconds since now

return.description: Wether the value has been correctly stored. False otherwise

description.compact: Checks whether a value is stored or not in the cache.

param.description: identifier key

return.description: True if the value exists in the cache, false otherwise

description.compact: Stablishes a new expiration TTL for an element in the cache.

param.description: The identifier key for the object to be touched
The new TTL (Time To Live) for the stored value in seconds
